Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: good
Approved too, but shouldn't there be a test with an invalid entry? In order to test if the algorithm is good in all cases?

I don't have any math background on this subject, the goal/explanation is not enough to understand what we need to do for test 5/6/7/8...

Please take more time to explain, I think one paragraph is not enough.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Realy fun to do, not that hard if you had already use the euler formula for sin and cos. It may be harder if you don't know complex. But it's a very good problem.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Goal
* Please change "Product" to "Products".

* Suggest to change the last sentence as follows (if my understanding is correct):

The goal here is to simplify an expression such as {{( sin(x)^[[S]] * cos(x)^[[C]] ) * [[F]]}}, where [[F]] is a factor given such that the constants/coefficients of the final product are always integers.

Input
* If you apply the above change regarding [[F]], then you may delete ", a factor that as to be applied to keep integers on the output."

Output
* Please explain the order of the terms (first the constant term, then in ascending order of the coefficient of {{x}} within each sin/cos term).

* Suggest to change the example of the format so that a coefficient of x won't appear twice (cos(x) and sin(x)). This is also related to second comment on Constraints below.

Constraints
* The constraint on [[F]] is incomplete.

* Maybe add a constraint that all the coefficients of {{x}} within each sin/cos term appear in the output expression once only? Otherwise you would have to explain the order to adopt in such a case (e.g. whether it should be cos(x)+sin(x) or sin(x)+cos(x)).

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.
Done, as for the cover picture I'll add it later, I have to find something first

Well the only background you know here is how to develop expression, and how to raise to a power, there isn't even a need to know what sine or complex are. The thing is that the base is always e, and the power always something times ix, so you can simply deal with a single integer. I can't see what you lack to be able to do test 1/2/3/4 but not 5/6/7/8, the numbers simply grow bigger

What would you want me to do ? To add a test with letters instead of numbers ? or numbers that do not follow the constraints like negative ones ? I think that's useless you pretty much simply need to check if a number is positive, otherwise print an error.
If you are talking about the factor, I added it because it makes the roundings unecessary, you can deal with everything as an int, having something that would end up with a float kinda break that purpose.
Not sure you were talking about that though

Maybe you should mention "binome de newton", don't know how to say it in english. Or show an example. For me it's not that hard because many people who code have a basic mathematical knowledge left over.

Thank you for your quick follow-up!

Output
* Please delete "Â±k_c1cos(x)".

* Please change "as to" to "need".

Constraints
* Please delete "the" in "the both".

Cover picture
* Pending.

Thanks again.
Don't forget the cover picture ðŸ˜‰
Yeah sorry I had other fish to fry and I forgot, that's done now.
